The in vitro release of the buckwheat flavonoids nanoemulsion and suspension were continuously monitored for 48 h. The cumulative release of the suspension was 5.17% in 15 min, and only 15.14% drug was released in 48 h because of its poor solubility ( Fig.Â
4 ). The nanoemulsion released 25.09% in 15 min, 42.56% in 1 h, and the cumulative release was increased gradually until 88.16% of the drug was released in 48 h. The results showed that the cumulative release efficiency of the nanoemulsion was 5-folds higher than that of the suspension, and the effect of drugs in vitro was greatly improved.
